thoughts_and_notions_1.1.title: Past Simple Tense
thoughts_and_notions_1.1.explanation: The Past Simple tense is used to talk about completed actions in the past. We use it for actions that happened at a specific time in the past or for past habits. Regular verbs add '-ed' (invent → invented), while irregular verbs have special forms (wear → wore).
rules: Use '-ed' for regular verbs: work → worked, play → played
Irregular verbs have unique forms: go → went, see → saw, wear → wore
Use 'did not' (didn't) + base form for negatives
Use 'did' + subject + base form for questions
examples: Whitcomb L. Judson invented the zipper in 1893. (specific time in past)
People wore high shoes with buttons. (past habit)
They didn't buy many of them. (negative form)
Did people like the first zippers? (question form)
thoughts_and_notions_1.1.ielts_connection: Past Simple is commonly used in IELTS Writing Task 1 for describing past trends and in Speaking Part 2 for describing past experiences.
